verses.roman:
viṣayīra vārtā śuni' kṣubdha haya mana
tāte ihāṅ rahi' mora nāhi prayojana"

synonyms: viṣayīra—of materialistic persons; vārtā—news; śuni'-hearing; kṣubdha—agitated; haya—becomes; mana—mind; tāte—therefore; ihāṅ rahi'-to stay here; mora—My; nāhi prayojana—there is no necessity.
translation: "If we hear about the activities of materialistic persons, our minds become agitated. There is no need for Me to stay here and be disturbed in that way."
